001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
010import java.util.Collections;
011
012/**
013 * This class defines a major component of the robot.
014 *
015 * <p>A good example of a subsystem is the drivetrain, or a claw if the robot has one.
016 *
017 * <p>All motors should be a part of a subsystem. For instance, all the wheel motors should be a
018 * part of some kind of "Drivetrain" subsystem.
019 *
020 * <p>Subsystems are used within the command system as requirements for {@link Command}. Only one
021 * command which requires a subsystem can run at a time. Also, subsystems can have default commands
022 * which are started if there is no command running which requires this subsystem.
023 *
024 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
025 *
026 * @see Command
027 */
028public abstract class Subsystem implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
029  /** Whether or not getDefaultCommand() was called. */
030  private boolean m_initializedDefaultCommand;
031  /** The current command. */
032  private Command m_currentCommand;
033
034  private boolean m_currentCommandChanged;
035
036  /** The default command. */
037  private Command m_defaultCommand;
038
039  /**
040   * Creates a subsystem with the given name.
041   *
042   * @param name the name of the subsystem
043   */
044  public Subsystem(String name) {
045    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, name, name);
046    Scheduler.getInstance().registerSubsystem(this);
047  }
048
049  /** Creates a subsystem. This will set the name to the name of the class. */
050  public Subsystem() {
051    String name = getClass().getName();
052    name = name.substring(name.lastIndexOf('.') + 1);
053    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, name, name);
054    Scheduler.getInstance().registerSubsystem(this);
055    m_currentCommandChanged = true;
056  }
057
058  @Override
059  public void close() {
060    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
061  }
062
063  /**
064   * Initialize the default command for a subsystem By default subsystems have no default command,
065   * but if they do, the default command is set with this method. It is called on all Subsystems by
066   * CommandBase in the users program after all the Subsystems are created.
067   */
068  protected abstract void initDefaultCommand();
069
070  /** When the run method of the scheduler is called this method will be called. */
071  public void periodic() {
072    // Override me!
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Sets the default command. If this is not called or is called with null, then there will be no
077   * default command for the subsystem.
078   *
079   * <p><b>WARNING:</b> This should <b>NOT</b> be called in a constructor if the subsystem is a
080   * singleton.
081   *
082   * @param command the default command (or null if there should be none)
083   * @throws IllegalUseOfCommandException if the command does not require the subsystem
084   */
085  public void setDefaultCommand(Command command) {
086    if (command == null) {
087      m_defaultCommand = null;
088    } else {
089      if (!Collections.list(command.getRequirements()).contains(this)) {
090        throw new IllegalUseOfCommandException("A default command must require the subsystem");
091      }
092      m_defaultCommand = command;
093    }
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns the default command (or null if there is none).
098   *
099   * @return the default command
100   */
101  public Command getDefaultCommand() {
102    if (!m_initializedDefaultCommand) {
103      m_initializedDefaultCommand = true;
104      initDefaultCommand();
105    }
106    return m_defaultCommand;
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Returns the default command name, or empty string is there is none.
111   *
112   * @return the default command name
113   */
114  public String getDefaultCommandName() {
115    Command defaultCommand = getDefaultCommand();
116    if (defaultCommand != null) {
117      return defaultCommand.getName();
118    } else {
119      return "";
120    }
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Sets the current command.
125   *
126   * @param command the new current command
127   */
128  void setCurrentCommand(Command command) {
129    m_currentCommand = command;
130    m_currentCommandChanged = true;
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Call this to alert Subsystem that the current command is actually the command. Sometimes, the
135   * {@link Subsystem} is told that it has no command while the {@link Scheduler} is going through
136   * the loop, only to be soon after given a new one. This will avoid that situation.
137   */
138  void confirmCommand() {
139    if (m_currentCommandChanged) {
140      m_currentCommandChanged = false;
141    }
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Returns the command which currently claims this subsystem.
146   *
147   * @return the command which currently claims this subsystem
148   */
149  public Command getCurrentCommand() {
150    return m_currentCommand;
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Returns the current command name, or empty string if no current command.
155   *
156   * @return the current command name
157   */
158  public String getCurrentCommandName() {
159    Command currentCommand = getCurrentCommand();
160    if (currentCommand != null) {
161      return currentCommand.getName();
162    } else {
163      return "";
164    }
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * Associate a {@link Sendable} with this Subsystem. Also update the child's name.
169   *
170   * @param name name to give child
171   * @param child sendable
172   */
173  public void addChild(String name, Sendable child) {
174    SendableRegistry.addLW(child, getSubsystem(), name);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Associate a {@link Sendable} with this Subsystem.
179   *
180   * @param child sendable
181   */
182  public void addChild(Sendable child) {
183    SendableRegistry.setSubsystem(child, getSubsystem());
184    SendableRegistry.enableLiveWindow(child);
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Gets the name of this Subsystem.
189   *
190   * @return Name
191   */
192  public String getName() {
193    return SendableRegistry.getName(this);
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Sets the name of this Subsystem.
198   *
199   * @param name name
200   */
201  public void setName(String name) {
202    SendableRegistry.setName(this, name);
203  }
204
205  /**
206   * Gets the subsystem name of this Subsystem.
207   *
208   * @return Subsystem name
209   */
210  public String getSubsystem() {
211    return SendableRegistry.getSubsystem(this);
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Sets the subsystem name of this Subsystem.
216   *
217   * @param subsystem subsystem name
218   */
219  public void setSubsystem(String subsystem) {
220    SendableRegistry.setSubsystem(this, subsystem);
221  }
222
223  @Override
224  public String toString() {
225    return getSubsystem();
226  }
227
228  @Override
229  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
230    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Subsystem");
231
232    builder.addBooleanProperty(".hasDefault", () -> m_defaultCommand != null, null);
233    builder.addStringProperty(".default", this::getDefaultCommandName, null);
234    builder.addBooleanProperty(".hasCommand", () -> m_currentCommand != null, null);
235    builder.addStringProperty(".command", this::getCurrentCommandName, null);
236  }
237}
